criticalSuccess: With explosive timing, you drive your leg into {targetName}'s ankles with devastating effect. Their feet fly out from under them and they crash to the ground with bone-rattling force, landing hard on their back, the wind knocked completely from their lungs!

You hook {targetName}'s leg at the perfect moment, wrenching it backward as your shoulder drives into their chest. The combination is devastating - they flip backward and slam into the ground with a sickening thud, completely stunned by the violent fall!

Your sweep catches both of {targetName}'s legs in one smooth motion. Their eyes go wide as they realize they're falling with no way to catch themselves. They crash to the ground hard, sprawled and disoriented!
success: You sweep {targetName}'s leg out, causing them to lose balance and fall to the ground. They manage to control the fall somewhat, but they're still prone and vulnerable.
Your trip catches {targetName} off-guard. They stumble, arms windmilling, before dropping to one knee and then going fully prone.
You successfully knock {targetName}'s feet from under them. They hit the ground with a grunt, now prone but already working to recover.
failure: You swing your leg to sweep {targetName}'s feet, but they shift their weight at the last second. Your sweep finds nothing but empty air as they maintain their balance.
Despite your best effort to trip {targetName}, they read your intention and lift their foot just enough to avoid it. Your technique was sound, but the timing was off.
You attempt to hook {targetName}'s leg, but they're too quick. They sidestep your sweep and remain standing, unfazed.
criticalFailure: You commit fully to sweeping {targetName}'s legs, but they jump over your attempted trip with ease. Your own momentum carries you through the failed sweep, and you spin awkwardly, nearly falling yourself. You're left off-balance and exposed!

Your overly ambitious trip attempt is telegraphed and clumsy. {targetName} not only avoids it but uses your poor positioning against you. You stumble, one leg extended awkwardly, barely keeping yourself from hitting the ground!

You sweep your leg with too much force and not enough control. {targetName} steps back casually, and your wild swing throws you completely off balance. You have to catch yourself to avoid falling flat on your face!

criticalSuccess: Like a seasoned warrior, you read {targetName}'s footwork perfectly. Your leg sweeps in with devastating precision, catching their ankle at the exact moment their weight shifts. The physics are inescapable - their feet fly out from under them with violent force. Time seems to slow as shock registers on their face. Then gravity reasserts itself with brutal authority. They crash to the ground with bone-jarring impact, the fall so hard it raises dust. They lie there, stunned and prone, while you stand over them in perfect balance!

Your trip is a masterclass in combat technique. With explosive power, you drive your shin into both of {targetName}'s legs while simultaneously pushing their upper body. The combination is devastating and inescapable. Their legs are swept clean out from under them, and they flip backward through the air before slamming into the ground with terrifying force. The impact echoes. They're not just prone - they're utterly rattled!
success: You execute a solid trip, your leg hooking {targetName}'s ankle at just the right moment. They lose balance and fall, hitting the ground with an audible thump. It's not the most spectacular takedown, but it's effective - they're prone and you're still standing.
With practiced technique, you sweep {targetName}'s leg. They try to catch themselves but fail, ending up on the ground. The trip works exactly as intended - nothing fancy, just good fundamentals.
failure: You attempt to sweep {targetName}'s legs with textbook form, but they read it perfectly. A subtle shift of weight, a small step back, and your trip finds nothing but air. Your technique was flawless, but so was their counter.

Despite your best effort and proper execution, {targetName} simply has better footwork. They dance away from your sweeping leg with frustrating ease, maintaining perfect balance while you're left reaching.
criticalFailure: In your aggressive attempt to trip {targetName}, you overcommit catastrophically. You swing your leg with too much power, too little control, telegraphing the move so obviously that {targetName} sees it coming from a mile away. They don't just avoid it - they practically step over your sweeping leg like it's not even there. Your momentum betrays you. You spin awkwardly, arms pinwheeling as you fight to stay upright. For one mortifying moment, it looks like you're going to trip yourself. You manage to stay standing, but barely, and you're left completely exposed!

Your attempted trip is executed with such poor timing and technique that it borders on comedy. You lunge forward, leg extended at an awkward angle, clearly telegraphing your intention. {targetName} doesn't even have to try hard to avoid it - they simply shift their weight slightly and watch as you sweep at empty air. Your wild swing throws you completely off balance. You stumble forward, nearly falling, arms flailing for equilibrium. What should have been {targetName} on the ground is instead you looking like a fool!
